title: seek3r
author: seek3r
created_time: December 05, 2022, 01:33:53 PMLast edit: December 11, 2022, 10:14:24 PM by seek3r
content: Due to the unexpectedly high demand, I have now decided to start an auction for this item:Up for sale is a 1 Million Satoshi Gold bar with the serial #22 which was made by Alpencoin and comes with the COA. This bar was limited to 100 pieces and sold out very quick.  https://blockstream.info/address/1EEEN5HC8DGcD4HJtANZikm8jjcRaeVpCH For more details use this reference by Alpencoin himself or the attached pictures.STARTING BID: 0.01 BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT: 0.0005 BTC END TIME: Dezember 11th, 2022, 23:00:00 GMT+1 (Hamburg time)TIMER: https://www.timeanddate.com/countdown/generic?iso=20221211T23&p0=307&msg=1+Million+Satoshi+GOLD+BAR&font=slab&csz=1AUCTION TERMSSNIPE: Any bid made in last 10 minutes will extend the auction 10 minutes beyond the ending time.If within those 10 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 10 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid.PAYMENT: I only accept Bitcoin to following address: 33eedyLSbqawsLZWexYxioHzvYDSxZ84xYPayment has to be done within 24 hours after the auction has ended.SHIPPING: WORLDWIDEShipping costs will be paid by the winner, winner is also responsible for any local customs/duties/VAT fees.Item will be shipped from Germany.ESCROW: Accepted at buyers expense - would prefer minerjones' service*** I also reserve the right to exclude anyone from bidding if they got a bunch of negative trust. ***

comments.author: seek3r
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on December 05, 2022, 04:09:42 PM.022 BTCHighest bid so far!A bit more than 4 days left  Don't miss your chance at this beauty!!!

comments.author: seek3r
comments.body: Important!!!Dont bid via DM, I can't accept bid/offers there. You have to do the bidding here!Current highest bid:Quote from: garciaor2002 on December 10, 2022, 05:21:10 PM.04Ends in less than 24 hours!

comments.author: seek3r
comments.body: Quote from: garciaor2002 on December 10, 2022, 05:21:10 PM.04Winning bid. Congrats! Will DM you with infos - dont forget the payment rule please.

comments.author: seek3r
comments.body: Still waiting for an answer of the winning bidder.  Since I haven't heard anything since the end of the auction and he has disregarded the following rule: Quote from: seek3r on December 05, 2022, 01:33:53 PMPAYMENT: I only accept Bitcoin to following address: 33eedyLSbqawsLZWexYxioHzvYDSxZ84xYPayment has to be done within 24 hours after the auction has ended.I will give him a total of 72 hours reaction time (that will be in 33 1/2 hours) from the end of the auction to get in touch.Otherwise I see the auction as canceled and will reschedule it in the next few days.I guess that this move is fair, isn't it?I'm happy to take suggestions on this, because I'm a little disappointed that this is happening right now at my first real auction. But terms are set up so that everything is clearly regulated.

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: seek3r on December 14, 2022, 12:38:08 PMStill waiting for an answer of the winning bidder.  Since I haven't heard anything since the end of the auction and he has disregarded the following rule: Quote from: seek3r on December 05, 2022, 01:33:53 PMPAYMENT: I only accept Bitcoin to following address: 33eedyLSbqawsLZWexYxioHzvYDSxZ84xYPayment has to be done within 24 hours after the auction has ended.I will give him a total of 72 hours reaction time (that will be in 33 1/2 hours) from the end of the auction to get in touch.Otherwise I see the auction as canceled and will reschedule it in the next few days.I guess that this move is fair, isn't it?I'm happy to take suggestions on this, because I'm a little disappointed that this is happening right now at my first real auction. But terms are set up so that everything is clearly regulated.Sorry to hear that. Happened to my acutions once or twice, too - it's really annoying.Hope they pay up soon.If not, I think a rescheduled auction is the way to go, yes. Let's hear what the OGs have to say about this, but giving it another go seems like the best option.

comments.author: Steeley
comments.body: I would offer the item to sunnybwoy or re-auction the item. You could consider leaving negative trust for the winner that failed to come through on their commitment. Steeley

comments.author: sunnybwoy
comments.body: I would be willing to take his offer thank you.

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: I say offer to next highest bidder. He would have been the winner if the other guy didnt bid it up and bailed.

comments.author: pinky1234
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptogreatdane on December 14, 2022, 08:16:00 PMI say offer to next highest bidder. He would have been the winner if the other guy didnt bid it up and bailed. I agree on that..

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: I did have some interaction with garciaor2022 on the 10th, he bought and paid for some items - I sent a message as he paid for 6 when only 4 were available so I had to do a partial refund. I have not heard back and it looks as though he has not been on since then either.If he defaults, it should fall to the next highest bid - my opinion.

comments.author: Agrawas
comments.body: I think it’s upto the OP, whatever he decides to do..
